Maryna Aleksandrova

UpdateImpact

UpdateImpact is a tool that allows you visualize, analyze and monitor dependencies tree of your project. The function of the website was to tell potential users about this tool and if / how it can be helpful for them as well as collect some feedback.

My role: website design and development (HTML/CSS). I also created and developed a series of SVG animations to better illustrate some of the functions of the tool.

Tools: Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, HTML, CSS, SVG, CSS animations, iTerm, Sublime Text, node.js, Jade, Stylus.

updateimpact.com

Goosta.me

Goosta.me is a prototype of a dating website with the feature of video text-chat. It was created for the Static Showdown Hackathon 2015 and won the second place.

My role: visual design and direction of the web app, web app development as well as copywriting.

Tools: Adobe Photoshop, HTML, CSS, CSS animations, iTerm, Sublime Text, Jade, Stylus.

goosta.me

Scala Times

Scala time is a weekly newsletter about Scala-related news and events. The project consists of newsletter design, website with newsletters archive and stickers design. The main idea behind was to somehow replicate look’n’feel of classic newspaper.

My role: design direction, visual design and development of Mailchimp template and website.

Tools: Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, HTML, CSS, Mailchimp Template Engine, Mailchimp API, iTerm, Sublime Text.

scalatimes.com

Scalar

Scalar is a one-day one-track Scala conference in Poland. The conference was founded in 2013.

My role: is everything imaginable:) It started with creation of the logo and visual identity for the conference. I also designed and developed conference website and newsletters template. I designed multiple printing materials for the conference: roll-ups, stickers, leaflets, banners, name tags, etc.

Tools: Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe InDesign, HTML, CSS, Mailchimp Template Engine, iTerm, Sublime Text, Jade, Stylus, Grunt.

scalar-conf.com

Codebrag

Codebrag is an open-source tool for code-reviewing. The main idea of the product is to simplify the process of code review, make it less tense and more fun and positive. It was in development for 2 years (2013-2015) and I was the only designer on the project. I worked closely with UX designer as well as developers.

My role: design direction, logo design, web app and website design and development.

Tools: Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, SVG, HTML, CSS, Jade, Stylus, node.js, iTerm, Sublime Text, Grunt.

codebrag.com
